title: iPHONE 15 WILL HAVE AN ACTION BUTTON?! New Rumors!
description: PLEASE SUBSCRIBE:  GET MY PINK iJUSTINE CABLES HERE:   GET MY EDITING PLUGIN:    MUSIC I USE:    GET YOUR OURA RING:    FRIEND ME HERE:        MY NEW PROJECT:   PODCAST:       WHAT I USE TO MAKE VIDEOS    CAMERAS: Sony a7 IV -  Sony a1 -   Sony a7s III -   Insta 360 ONE X3 -  Insta 360 ONE RS -  Insta 360 GO2 -   LENSES: New Sony GM 24-70mm ii -  Older Sony GM 24-70mm -  New Sony Sony 20-70mm -  Sony GM 16-35mm -  Sony GM 50mm -  Sony GM 135mm -  Sony GM 85mm -
transcript: - We are getting closer and closer to the new iPhone 15 and iPhone 15 Pro. I actually can't believe that it is almost here. I mean, I say almost, we still have a few months. So let's just go through and check out some of the rumors. I feel like most of the things have already been kind of leaked already, so let's see if there's any updates. So this article on 9TO5Mac I kind of liked because it kind of gives you the breakdown of Apple's charging ports of the past. So we had the 30-pin to Lightning and it's kind of wild because I didn't even think about this. "Apple only made five models using the original charging port, and that was launched 16 years ago." Sixteen! I know. I just can't even handle that thought. And "still, the public reaction to when the iPhone 5 switched to the current Lightning port was not exactly positive in 2012," says the article. And I don't really remember how I felt. I mean I don't think I was upset about it necessarily, 'cause like that charging port was so massive that they then went to something faster and smaller. Like why would, I don't know. Now, a year later, Apple stopped including the power adapter to save the planet and replaced USB-A to Lightning with USB-C for the iPhone 12." You'll be able to continue uploading either on cellular or on Wi-Fi when you get back to any Wi-Fi service. So that's actually pretty cool. And I'm a huge fan of AirDrops, so definitely hyped about that. Now, this is showing a visual of, obviously, somebody using MagSafe to charge, which I feel like a lot of people now, that's pretty much how you charge your phone.
